conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on blocks A and B to find the mass ratio.
Block B is pushed by a horizontal force and is in close contact with block A.
The contact surface between A and B is vertical.
Identify forces on Block B: Horizontal Force (F), Normal Force (N_AB), Frictional Force (f_AB), Weight of Block B (m_B g), Normal Force from Ground (N_B).
Since block B is about to slide down, f_AB = m_B g, thus N_AB = m_B g / μ_1.
Identify forces on Block A: Normal Force (N_BA), Frictional Force (f_BA), Weight of Block A (m_A g), Normal Force from Ground (N_A), Frictional Force from Ground (f_AG).
Since block A is about to slip, f_AG = N_BA = m_B g / μ_1.
Normal force N_A is the sum of the weights of blocks A and B: N_A = m_A g + m_B g.
Equation: μ_2 (m_A g + m_B g) = m_B g / μ_1.
Divide both sides by g: μ_2 (m_A + m_B) = m_B / μ_1.
Rearrange for mass ratio m_A/m_B: μ_2 m_A + μ_2 m_B = m_B / μ_1.
Solve for m_A/m_B: μ_2 m_A = m_B (1/μ_1 - μ_2).
Final mass ratio: m_A/m_B = (1 - μ_1 μ_2) / (μ_1 μ_2).
